text: Bottled at Haket, Göteborg, on June 16, 2017.Thanks to Tomas when he was sampling some varuprover, so not (at least not yet) part of their regular selection. As a blind tasting.4.3% ABV, 33 cl bottle, BB 03/04/19.Hazy golden color, white head. Malty, a bit herbal hoppy, faint citrus scent. Malty, slight herbal, some bitter, faint hoppy taste. Mineral, herbal aftertaste. Fizzy mouthfeel, medium low bitterness. Feels like a generic pale ale with low hop character.5/3/6/2/10=2.6

Caňa en el Lúpulo Oviedo 30..05.. 2017. (r160). Color amarillento velado con espuma blanca fina. Sabores frescos maltosos y cereales afrutados con toques herbáceos también frescos. Buena combinación de herbaceos y ligeros afrutados con cuerpo ligero a medio más menos fino suave y espumoso. Buena sensación alcohólica. Bastante buena para repetir.

Keg @El Lúpulo Feroz, Oviedo. 29-05-2017.
Pours hazy pale godl with frothy white head. Moderate head retention, little lacing. Malt forward bitter, overall sweet, some herbal. Medium body, average carbonation, crispy texture.

Bottle 33cl. Pours hazy orange beer with a light white head. Aroma is fruity, grapefruit, hops. Light to medium body, flat to soft carbonation. Taste is light to medium bitter, bitter finish. Nice Ipa. 05/17

33cl Bottle @ LaBIRRAtorium, Madrid, Spain.
Hazy amber colour with a thin white head.
Aroma is malt, sweet, hops, citrus, fruits, grass.
Taste is malt, sweet, citrus, bitter, mango.
Medium body, average carbonation.

330 ml bottle. Pours a hazy dark golden-brown with a large white head. The aroma is very hoppy - tropical fruits, passion fruit, oranges. Light to medium body with a medium carbonation and a light to medium bitterness. The flavor is again dominated by the hops (lemon, oranges) and rather full for the low ABV. Bitter hoppy finish.

Color entre naranja y marrón, turbio, con capa de espuma blanca de dos dedos de grosor (buena retención). Carbonatación media tirando a baja. Aroma cítrico, a lúpulo, resina. Sabor plano, refrescante, donde apenas se distingue nada (algo de cítrico, algo de lúpulo, algo de malta...). Casi como beber agua carbonatada con un toque frutal y amargo. Final muy ligeramente amargo, postgusto herbal.

Tasted on 19.11.16. Delicate hoppy aroma of flowers and fruits. Small head. Cloudy golden colour. Quite intensive and very pleasant hoppy bitterness with delicate fruity sweetness. Dry body but not watery.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Punks do it butter. Potworne masło w aromacie :Z

Aus dem Fläschchen beim WINTER BEER DAY 2016 verköstigt. Zu diesem Zeitpunkt hat mich der Name des Bieres in die Irre geführt. Ich hielt es für ein English Bitter und war deshalb erstaunt, wie Pale Ale lastig hopfbitter und fruchtig der Sud ins Rennen geht. Und so viel Kraft und Aroma bei nur 4,3%. Wooowwww. Nice. 0,1/1.
Pours amber colored with white head. Fruity aroma. Malty taste with a descent bitter finish and soft carbonation. Good beer.

Bottle
Aroma-fruits, floral, pineapple, peach
Appearance-orange, hazy, white foam, 
Taste-medium bitterness, medium sourness, light sweetness, 
Palate-medium body, sticky, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-very good

Ambra chiaro, con schiuma sottile biancastra e pannosa. Aroma floreale ed erbaceo. Al palato ottima, ingresso floreale, erbe, retrogusto bello amarognolo. Corpo medio, carbonazione medio bassa. Davvero niente male.

Bottle from The Bottle Lab, Leek. Pours a clear deep golden to pale amber colour with a fizzy white head. Aroma of melon, orange, lemon, some tea, slight grapefruit, a little fruit, subtle pepper, biscuity, bready malts and floral hops. Taste of melon, orange, grapefruit, tea, some fruit, slight biscuity, bready malts and subtle grassy, floral hops. Medium bodied and moderate to high carbonation. A soft, dry, floral hop bitterness in the finish. Definitely interesting, like a modern EPA. English bitter maltiness crossed with American APA hoppiness. Enjoyed it.

Keg at Lambiczoon Milan. A hazed golden orange coloured pour with a lasting sticky white head. Aroma is nice big tropical fruit, pineapple, Nelson, little caramel malts. Nice Hoppy nose. Flavour is composed of semi sweet malts, biscuit and caramel, tropical fruit, mango, pineapple. Little grain husks. Palate is grainy, moderate carbonation. Good IPA.
On tap at Tribaun. Aroma is fresh pine and a little bubblegum, some citrus. Flavour is bitter and hoppy. Lots of lemon, some pine and a bitter maltiness left at the end.
Nice bitterness, medium body, crispy hoppiness, citrus aromas and grape fruit. Well balanced and tasty for this low abv.

On tap at cheek2cheek. Hazy light orange color, thick white head. Mostly american hops upfront, APA style, light malt, leaves, hay and minerals. Light body, soft carbonation, very easy to drink. Mild bitter taste, floral hopy finish. Ok EPA/bitter.

Amber /orange with small white head. Nice fruity aroma (citrus, mango).Good strong bitterness followed by fruity notes. Some waterness and metallic notes later. But overall not bad and refreshing. Session IPA rather than English pale ale. Hoppy bitter aftertaste.

On tap, HL. On tap. Hazy amber body with white stable head. Aroma has fruity character, little bit grassy. Taste has high bitterness, grassy with fruity notes, mostly citrus, malty sweetness. Body is full, high carbonation.
English Palestina Ale. On tap no bar Le Fine Mousse em Paris. $5. Aroma bem bacana. Amargor médio com sabor. Bem refrescante.
Hazy golden orange color. Decent white head which stays. Aroma has some sweet malts and citrus hops notes in it. Lively carbonation. Fruity aftertaste. Good mild bitter English Pale Ale, enoyable.
On tap at BBF. Golden colour with white head. Mild aroma. Mild taste, slightly sweet. bitter. Light to medium body.

33cl Bottle from Vonk, just past bb date. Hazy glowing golden orange colour, off-white head. Aroma of sweet malts, cookies, light floral citrus hops, some orange. Smells a bit old, as expected. Flavour is soft, malty, some caramel, honey, fruity, orange, soft floral citrus, light bitter finish. Light bodied. OK.

Aroma: oranges, other citrus fruits, grain malts. Bottle of lactose. Appearance: clear gold, medium, creamy, white head. Taste: light bitter. Palate: light bitters continue, very fruity, floral hops, light grass, very bitter finish. Overall: nice EPA, great palate. Pint at Craft Beer Rising, Shoreditch.

On Tap. @V Barcelona Beer Festival.Del 04 al 06/03/2016 
Color amarillo, sabor frutal, cuerpo ligero.
Ottima bitter!!! Un amaro spiccato ma piacevole donato dalla giusta luppolatura
ottima bitter non è facile trovarne di cosi buone in giro sentori agrumati dati dal luppolo ben in risalto.

33cl bottle shared at the Paas monthly tasting. 
Thin white head. Hazy golden pour. Lovely citrus bitterness.

From 0,75l bottle, BBD: 28.01.2017 Pours light cloudy golden liquid, big frothy white head, Aroma: elderflowers, citrus, lemon peel, peach, floral, not so intensive, as expected, but fine, Taste: light to medium sweet, medium bitter, light to medium sour, elderflower, citrus, lemon peel, apricot, flowers, pineapple juice, but still light on intensity, Palate: light ot medium body, soft carbonation, slick to creamy mouthfeel, long fruity bitter aftertaste, Overall: fine, drinkable, enjoyable, but nothing special, just fine.
Molto profumata e subito interessante. Bella in bocca dove la sua facilità di beva la fa da padrona.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Bottiglia @ Simei 2015, Milano. Il gusto al naso rimanda al luppolo. Lintensità olfattiva è molto elevata e la persistenza olfattiva è considerevole. Le bollicine che arrivano alla superficie sono fini. La consistenza del liquido è limpida. Il colore è giallo dorato carico. Il corpo è strutturato non pesante. Lamaro è carico. Lintensità gustativa è molto elevata e la persistenza gustativa è buona e lunga. Il gusto è godereccio. Le sensazioni boccali finali sono luppolate. I sentori sono di pane, frutta secca e agrumi.
Couleur brune aucune mousse. Nez fruité exotique et malté. Gout fruité exotiques, litchis, résine et note maltée. Corps assez leger. Fin résineuse.
Bottle 33cl, a cloudy copper beer with huge head. Nose is on exotic fruits, mango. Aroma is on exotic fruit too, low body, metallic notes, very classic and boring.
33cl @ bottle. Aroma floreale di bel colore chiaro tendente allambrato. Finale più amaro e birra molto beverina

Bottle from Det Gode Brygg, Sandnes. Pours clear dark golden with a big creamy white head. Aroma of nice spicy hops. Taste is dry and crisp hops, spicy EKG and some grapefruit as well. Light sticky mouthfeel, good.
Klar gyllen farve med lyst skum. Lukt av blomster, gress, humle og malt. Smak av gress, grapefrukt, furunål og humle. Tørr og bitter ettersmak. Det Gode Brygg.
Cloudy golden with a small white head. Fruity and malty tones. Malt, fruit, caramel and hops. Medium to light body with a nice dry finish.
Bue en bouteille. Blonde plutôt claire. Houblons anglais, faible corpulence. Légère, finale courte. Bel équilibre général.

Lukt: Malt, citrus og en anelse smør.
Utseende: Fin honning farge.
Skum/kullsyre: Dekkende skum, heng langs kant.
Smak: Citrus og en anelse smør.
Hvor: Kjø[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Gode Brygg, Sandnes, [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */
Medium: [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */,3%, Nå[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */
Süffiger, herb bitterer Antrunk. Spritzig, trocken, runde Malzigkeit. Spritzig hopfig, lang anhaltend bitterer Nachhall. 10/8/9/8/10/9
Yeah. Fine. Nothing more, nothing less. A bit of a throwback to a time when ale was uninspiring but perfectly drinkable.

UPDATED: AUG 16, 2015 Schiuma compatta, a grana grande. Colore giallo carico, tendente al marrone. Al naso luppolo, cascade, pompelmo, agrumi, resine, ma alncje frutta molto matura nel finale. In bocca subito amaro, bilanciato dal fruttato del luppolo. Rotonda, fresca, beverina. Amaro persistente. Ottima
Orange/Golden with creamy head; nose is malts, hops, flowers and fruit. Taste adds more citrus and malts. Smooth and light, medium bitterness. Nice light ale.

(bottle, 33cl) Hazy, deep golden colour with a firm, medium-sized and slightly cream-coloured foamy head. Fresh, fruity and floral hoppy aroma with notes of lemon, grapefruit and blackcurrant, backed by a mildly biscuity malty touch. Moderately bitter flavour, light bodied but not watery with an almost crisp carbonation. Dry, mildly malty base with a good dash of fruity and slightly flowery hops, lingering into the dry and hop bitter finish with a delicately grassy tail. Good. 26.III.15
Hazy amber to orange color, minimal white head. Grassy hops aroma with long bitter citrusy finish. Thin to medium body, average carbonation. Very nice.

On cask at Il Santi Bevitore. Pours a hazy dark gold with some fluffy, white head. Nose has lemon and malt... not much else, maybe some years, lightly floral. Flavor has mostly malt, sweet breakfast bread, some caramel malt, some orange. Watery finish. Generic pub ale.

On pump at craven Road, Benevento. Aroma of light tropical feuit, tangerine peel,grapefruir. Smooth,watery, with a light bready maltiness. Lemon zest, tangerine, medium bitternes with light citrus notes. Extreme drinkability, very good one.
Bottle from the local city market, a rare delicacy in these parts. Nice bitterness, medium body, crispy hoppiness, citrus aromas and grape fruit. Well balanced and tasty for this low abv.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Cloudy golden color, white head. Aromatic hop flavor, good balance. Medium body, medium carbonation. Nice!
Pours pale amber. Initial taste has wood and grass, a very earthen taste. Not much bitterness to it, actually, just a brief bite. Still, for a pale ale it has a lot of character that I enjoyed!

Aroma: bread, spruce, citrus, Appearance: amber clear liquid with yellowish head. Taste: light sweetness, very bitter, lightly sour, fruity, grapefruit. Palate: light body, watery feel, average carbonation, astringent, long bitter finish,

Aroma: bread, citrus, spruce shoot. Appearance: golden, cloudy, white foam, frothy standing head. Taste: medium bitterness, lightly sour. Palate: medium body, creamy, average carbonation, astringent, medium bitter finish.

0.33L bottle. Flower perfume and hop aroma, smells like as a sweaty woman. Hazy orange color with massive whit hat. Stays. Seems this crap is over carbonated a little. Anyway fresh citrus fuits taste with good vegetable soup mix is ok. Little raw field cereal mouthfeel. Carbonating disturbs a little.
Negligible smell. Amber colour, high white head. Aroma of hops, base, some grass. Very mild aroma, also mild

from Fork & Bottles - gusher ! ... cloudy copper-orange beer with a persistent pale beige foam; clear and fair hoppy aroma of lichies and grapefruits; moderate malt backbone, fizzy and pretty tasty, fresh, bitter and dry; long fruity hoppy finish (apple, melon), light almondy

Tried on tap and in bottle. Colour is burnt orange/amber. Aroma is fruity, tropical, sweet malts. Taste is tropical fruits with light bitter hoppy after taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bue en bouteille de 75cl à la brasserie, couleur blonde, pas de mousse et peu deffervescence, nez sur le pamplemousse et le citron.
Début sur lamertume et ensuite ataque pamplemousse et le fruit de la passion, final courte mais grosse amertume qui casse absolument tout.

330 ml bottle. Lovely amber, quite clear, with a big, fluffy and persistent white head. Floral and perfumy nose, lot of lemongrass, slightly dusty, bready/biscuity malts, slightly toasted and nutty as well. Very sessionable, its one of those beer you could drink multiple times without palate fatigue. Malty, slightly fruity, very mild bitterness, quite dry. Subtle sourness in the end. Average carbonation, light to medium body, creamy texture. Good.

UPDATED: MAR 22, 2015 Hazy orange with compact white head. Spicy fruity aroma. Taste is mostly bitter, with notes of burnt malt. Fruitness comes out as warming.  Lively carbonation, harsh finan. Nice brew but almost out of style.

33cl bottle. Pours cloudy amber with a thick white head. Tropical sweet fruity aroma, floral notes. Flavor has grapefruity bite, citrus, sweet fruits. Nice hoppy bitter finish. Smooth, pleasant, very good. Thin.
Limpsisin sobra klaasist, oli väga hea - super. Tasakaalus, parajalt morkjas, hea lohn ja maitse. Tahaks veel yhte.

Light yellow with good dense creamy whitish head, good lacing. Looks good. Fresh mango, bit pineapple, bit berries, caramel malt. Light and fizzy, long grapefruit dry and bitter finish, fruity. Enjoyed, refreshing, nicely light.

A nice appearance, hazy, slightly brown, a blond head is big, clouding and fluffy. The aroma has strong grapefruits and lemon, some meat. Taste is strongly grapefruity, some pine needles, fresh, medium bitterness, the end is strongly piney. Almost medium bodied, smooth carbonation. This is very good beer, fluffy and fresh.
Draft from Amsterdam bar in Helsinki. Amber in color a bit hazy. Light head, citrus and grapefruit bouquet. Taste is light and crisp with nice citrus hoppyness.

Cloudy amber color, big white head. Some lacing. Light to medium body, soft carbonation. Aroma of pine, citrus, malt. Disappointingly watery texture. Taste is light sweet and light bitter. Little bit flat. Nothing exciting here, expected a lot more.
Bottle 0.33l. Dirty pale yellow hazy liquid with big head. Light body, almost no carbonation. Light bitterness, watery, very thin. Disappointing.

Draught @ Olut Expo Finland 2014
Aroma has sweet fruity tones, some strawberries and resiny malt. Flavour has resiny tones, fruity hops, hints of minerals and woody notes. Somewhat far from EPA, more like APA  or a session IPA. Refreshing and nice anyway.
Hazy. Hoppy on nose. Lemon, peach, flowers. Dry one, little malty notes and very drinkable. Refreshing west coast APA.
Pours cloudy deep orange,white head. Aroma is some malts and quite hoppy. Taste is malt,good hop bitterness.

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2014 [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Tolly Joogipood. Pours hazy amber with medium head. Aroma of hops, citrus, flowers.Taste of Citrusand peach, nice bitter finish. Good beer
Draught. Golden hazy with creamy head, excellent duration.Aroma and taste are bitter hops, flowers, citrus, grain and malt. Dry finish.

On tap at Il Santo Bevitore, Venice. Golden colour with a fine white head. The aroma is light malt, English hop character, some peachy and also grapefruity notes. Nice and dry, medium to light bodied, some sweetness and fruity hoppy notes. Pleasant, good.

Shared by martjoobolut, thanks! Murky yellow, messy beige head. Fruity nose with pine notes, peaches. Flavor is malt, hops, fruit, some sweetness. Grainy sourness inn the finish along with pineapple and grapefruit, OK bitterness. Airy palate.

0,33L bottle, BB 11.06.16. Pours golden with off-white head. The head stays for some time. Aroma is tropical fruits, citrus, mango, and malt. Flavor is sour, tropical fruits, mango, curacao. Finish is bitter orange. Overall: nice fruity brew.

Bottle. Orange hazy. Hoppy nose. Herby greens, some citrus, pretty nice, no overkill. Caramelly bisquity malts. Light med bodied, bitter. And dry. Doesnt strike me as too sharp though, has malts and caramel to balance it out. But a bitter pale ale for sure. Flavourful nice.

330ml bottle. Hazy orange pour with big head. Aroma is grapefruit, berries, grass, caramel. Smells kinda like a hopped up bitter. Juicy, resinous taste with the same elements from the aroma figuring. Hops give it a nice bitterness. Nothing spectacular, but I cant fault it too much.

Bottle at Winston Fest.
Hazy murky, steady beige head. Harsh, sweetish aroma. Light-bodied. Grainy, vegetably, some citrus. Harsh even yeasty.

0,33l bottle from drink bar at Tallinn. Doesnt have any foam, probably because its too cold. But despite that, this a perfect Pale Ale, I asked for a Pale Ale and i got one. It doesnt have any surprise, wow effect or anything but its just too damn fine Pale Ale... credit for that!
330ml bottle. Hazy orange color. Small size, white head, stays. Oranges, fruity, sweet notes in aroma. Yeasty, fruity, sweetish, spicy taste. Spicy spruce in aftertaste.
Bottle @ home. Aroma is fruity zesty hops, loads of citrus. Light malt note. Flavour is medium dry and light bitterness with big fruity citrus hops, light wort like finish. Nice one.

Light orange hazy beer with white head. Aroma has creamy fruity apricot, slight tartness. Flavor is dry bitter, malty and fruity. Palate is quite thin. Finishes with short but quite intense bitterness. Aftertaste of dry woody bitterness. More fruitiness than most British bitters, but still not impressive.

Dobre EPA. Aromatyczne smaczne i tresciwe, a zarazem delikatne, pijalne i przyjemne. Goryczkowe poprawnie, slodowosci nie za wiele. Piana spora trwala i przede wszystkim bardzo metne. Etykieta Punkowo Rockowa, troche rewolucyjna, to mi sie podoba, zwlaszcza pod wzgledem muzycznym:)
Hoppy aroma of caramel malts, citrus, some tropical fruits. Flavour is fruity, some caramel, with a nice bitter finish. A light and very sessionable APA.
Tap at Tuulensuu. Hazy orange, white head. Citrus hops, caramel malts in the aroma. Fresh, citrus and caramel flavor.

Tap @ Gastropub Tuulensuu.
Pours hazy orange color with a small head. Hops and mandarin on the nose, caramel also. Fruity, caramel taste, some grass and mild resin. light and tasty enjoyable brew.
3515

Bottle sample at a tasting at the Beer & Beyond shop. Thanks Tom L. Pours yellow hazy with a beige head, aroma is fresh with mango, pineapple, flavor is bitter and slightly dry with lemon skin, medium bodied.

Bottle sample at a tasting at the Beer & Beyond shop. Thanks Tom L. Cloudy golden with a white head. Rather hoppy aroma with overripe tropical fruits and some yeasty fruitiness. Sweetish yeasty and fruity flavor with some fruity hops and a finish with mild to moderate bitterness. Medium-bodied. Decent. More American than English in character.
UPDATED: SEP 28, 2014 Draught @ Osteria della Birra, Bergamo. A bit hazy golden beer with a small white head. Aroma is caramel malts, citric and grassy hops. Flavour is quite bitter.

Schiuma fine, ma non persistente, bel colore oro carico; al naso sentori laroma del luppolo la fa da padrone, floreale ed erbaceo; lascia la bocca asciutta e un amaro assai persistente. Nel complesso un ottima birra.

Si presenta con un bel colore giallo ambrato assai carico, una schiuma grossolana e non persistente, al naso frutti gialli pesca e albicocca, profumi leggermente floreali e resinosi, in bocca si sente il malto ma è beverina asciutta con un finale secco, si sentono ancora note fruttate e floreali del luppolo e lamaro cè ed è persistente ma non ingombrante o esagerato. Insomma una birra equilibrata e beverina che non stanca! Ottima!
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein dunkel bernsteinfarbenes Bier mit ordentlicher Schaumkrone. Geruch malzig, hopfig fruchtig, blumig. Geschmack leicht röstmalzig, fruchtig bitter, blumig.

330ml bottle. Slightly cloudy golden colour with huge, frothy, half-way lasting, minimally lacing, white head. Floral and minimally fruity hoppy aroma, cautious biscuit malty basis. Taste is bitter and floral hoppy, subtle pale malty sweetness, a spicy yeasty touch. Nice.

On tap at Elavs pub in Bergamo alta. Refreshing and light, but not obvious. Simple malts, but most of all hops, aromatic, citrus aroma and taste with a nice light bitter aftertaste. Perfect with a piadina.

Very misty orange brown body. Stable frothy head. Very delicate yet rich and interesting mix of hops and sweet malts. Very tasty hop aroma without being overly bitter. Works really well. Dry and fairly short ending. Interesting mix if styles, I like it. (33cl bottle from Saveur Bière)

330 ml bottle. L096/13. BB 08/2015. From saveur-biere.com.
Lively cloudy darkish amber colour with a huge foamy white head. 
Strong fruity and piney hoppy aroma with quite a lot sweetness and some bitterness. More American than English touch in the aroma. The flavour is dry hops, mild metal, mild bitterness, dry grainy malt and mild fruity sweetness. Nice low ABV brew with a great deal of taste.

Bottle at home
Bit of a gusher . 
Pours rather clear light orange / dark yellow . 
Good white foam fades very fast, big bubbles . 
Smell has some faded hops . 
Taste is really light ( It IS a low ABV beer ) . Tastes like a british bitter, more than an English ale  . 
bit bitter, not really hoppy . very drinkable . Some corn . Not really intence or anything, just an easy drinking beer . 
Rather high carbo 
Cool label !

Ecco qui: un pale ale con una luppolatura come si deve. Nel gusto si intrecciano note sia agrumate che floreali di luppolo, che soddisfano pienamente il palato. Corpo molto leggero, ma conforme allo stile.
0,4l on tap @ Cosmic Comic Cafe. Pours clear golden with a medium head. Aroma is malts and fruits. Flavor is thin with malts and hops. Could use a higher ABV.

Bottle from Luppolo LOttavo Nano, PalermoHazy deep blond color with small head. The mild malt aroma has some characteristic English hop and almost a touch of smoke. The mouthfeel is dry, a bit overly carbonated, with some dry caramel flavor, correct bitterness, some yeast.Reasonably English Ale.
bottle a dark golden yellow colored beer with a white head aroma malts citrus fruits and hops flavor malts citrus fruits pineapple grapefruits and bitter hops

UPDATED: AUG 23, 2014 Bottiglia 33cl, comprata da spirito di vino e bevuta a casa. Ambrata con schiuma fine e persistente. Poco corpo, beverina, amarognola con richiami agrumati, scorza di limone, finale medio ed amaro. Ben fatta ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhold

UPDATED: OCT 6, 2013 Bottle 33 cl. Pours slightly hazy copper in color with white bubbly head. Fruity citrus with some light floral and perfumey notes as well. Medium/light body. Has a midbitter aftertaste. Very nice. Y

Bottle @ home. Profumo intenso di succo di frutta allalbicocca, note erbacee/resinose di luppolo in sottofondo. Fruttato dominante. Colore giallo ambrato carico, velata, schiuma bianca grossolana e non molto persistente.
In bocca è ancora fruttata ma spiccano note agrumate di luppolo, con sensazione astringente. Secca, poco corposa, quasi watery, nessun calore alcolico ma ok così per lo stile. Buona!

(draught) pours a hazy golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of heavy resin, white grapes, yeast, lemons, light powdered sugar and pineapple. flavour is mostly the same, light tropical fruit, treebark and grass. light-bodied with average carbonation.

On tap at Mondial de la Bière Mulhouse 2013.
Gushed, cloudy amber with a large foam head. 
Aromas: apricot and cereals, hops but also dust and an unpleasant cardboard note. 
Too carbonated, not drinkable enough for a EPA, finish is short.

Apa bionda. Poca schiuma. Profumata. Corpo leggero. Buon retrogusto maltato. Non troppo amara

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330 ml bottle.
Almost a gusher. Pours a cloudy amber copper colour with a large foamy head. Aroma of sweet mango, apricot, grass and weak grainy notes. Flavour of sweet sweet mango, some caramel, dust, ashtray, grassy hops and weak floral notes. Also, some unpleasant cardboard notes. High viscosity. Medium bodied, high carbonation and a foamy mouthfeel. Finishes sweet, floral and quite strong on apricot jam. Too sweet and jam-like. Not at its best anymore I think.

UPDATED: SEP 29, 2015 Color: nice hazy blond beer with small carbonation and small white foam. Smell: hops, wheat and floral/herbs nose. Taste: strong floral and herbs taste with nice equilibrium of bitterness. Aftertaste: floral, sugar and bitterness.
Bottle 0.33l at Viisi Penniä, Helsinki. BBE 02/2015. Colour is clear orange with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, citrus, hops and some malts. More like APA than EPA.

UPDATED: APR 21, 2014 330ml bottle ( Viisi Pennia, Helsinki )
Super fruity hop aroma. Canned peaches, complete with the syrup. Some pineapple too, tinned too, obviously, and with its syrup as well. Fairly watery palate, decent carbonation. Rather simple aromatically hops in the taste too. High drinkability, but quite a simple formulation. Nice to see some bottle conditioning,  and a slight haze, unlike some fake punks. Bitterness quite pungent  almost acrid, but as youd expect from a modern IPA. Once a bit of crud is in the glass  g the palate is fuller. Theres a more bready grain aspect too. For supermarket strength this is very good.

330ml bottle @ Viisi Penniä, Helsinki

Pours dark orange with a smooth head. Aroma of musty hops, grass, hints of gooseberries. Taste is hoppy, slightly fruity with notes of gooseberries, grassy hops and caramel. Finish is dry and bitter with some smooth maltiness and hints of grass. A bit light bodied, but quite hoppy for an English pale ale.

(Bottle, 0.33 l - BBE 02/2015, at Oluttupa Viisi Penniä, 20130419) The beer poured cloudy and golden. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had fruitiness, citricness, berries and pine. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were fruitiness, citricness, pine, berries, white bread, malts and bitterness. Afteraste was bitter. No way this is an English Pale Ale. The hop profile points directly to USA. A nice beer with unpleasant berry sidenotes.

Bottle 33 cl, BBE 02/2015. Pours slightly hazy copper in color with white bubbly head. Fruity citrus with some light floral and perfumey notes as well. Grassy bitterness and soapy notes in taste too. Has a midbitter aftertaste though. Easy to drink, but the soapy notes lowers the score a bit.

Robe ambrée, mousse et bulles légères. Nez engageant avec des notes de zestes doranges confits. Bouche : attaque sur une amertume délicate, assez ronde ensuite. Finale sur des jolies notes pamplemousse. Houblonnage et amertume bien dosés sans excès. Beaucoup de caractère pour un très faible degré dalcool (cette bière peut "mettre une claque" à pas mal dIPA). Bravo !

UPDATED: NOV 19, 2015 Pallido e limpido color arancio con un velo cremoso di schiuma bianca. Aroma floreale e fruttato con sentori agrumati e luppolati; gusto ampiamente luppolato ma non esageratamente amaro, note più delicate di caramello e arancia. Corpo medio-lieve, poco effervescente e dissetante.

Golden mandarin color.
Nice hoppy fruity aromas. 
Same in taste, but quickly fades away. 
Enjoyable beer, but nothing superb about it.

0.33l bottle @ Amarone. This is a cloudy deep orange one with a nice big light fluffy and definitely lasting off-white top. Lovely fresh fruity nose with loads of perfumy goodness. Oh, my this smells just fantastic! Did not expect this at all. Its spot on average on the carbonation with a light oily mouthfeel. Lots of flavor in this little thing! Its really fresh and refreshingly hoppy with a slightly minerally touch. Fruity melon, strawberries and some sour-plum. Really sessionable, enjoyable and quenching. A surprise indeed. 11.01.2013
Golden coloured and hazy. Has a white head, medium duration. Heavy hoppy aroma, us-hops. Flavor starts moderate sweet, finish heavy bitter. Dry texture.
sweet hoppy aroma,orange, hazy, white foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, dry hoppy,bitter finish.

Bottle at home ... hazy amber ... big bubbly off white head ... soft zezty pine hop ... sweet fruits ... juicy hop ...
very sweet fruits ... juicy hop ... nice
Bottle at Craigs house. Dark golden colour with quite a lot of haze. Medium head. Grass.

Bottle @ Århus / Randers newyears tasting at Hansen and Zita. Pours slightly hazy golden with a offwhite head. Aroma of malt, grass, citrus, fruity hops. Flavor is malt, grass, bitter fruity hops, grapefruit. Medium body, lively carbonation, bitter finish. 281212

Bottle, 4.3%. Hazy dark yellow/amber with big off-white head. Aroma is malt, hops, citrus and a little earthy. Flavour is malt, fruit, hop, little sweet, medium bitter, citrus, little grapefruit and a little earthy.
Bottle. Creamy white good mostly lasting head. Dark yellow colour. MOderate malty and heavy hoppy aroma. Moderate malty and hoppy flavor. Average moderate bitter finish. Oily palate.

Bottle @ Hansen/Zita tasting. Hazy golden with a lasting off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and moderate hoppy - fruity and flowers. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 281212
Bottle. Huge creamy head with excellent duration. Color is hazy golden. Aroma and taste are bitter hops, flowers, citrus, grain and malt. Dry finish.

Bottle at the Fork and Bottle, Zurich, December 2012. Pours clear to hazy golden, bubbly, small white head. Pine, pineapple and mango in the nose, bitter, alightly fruity-hoppy taste. Light to medium body, fizzy, hoppy-fruit finish. Balanced and well done.
UPDATED: JAN 8, 2014 On tap. Colore arancio carico, abbondante luppolatura da dry hopping e gusto agrumato e floreale, retrogusto amarotico ma non eccessivamente persistente.
Ambrato scarico buona schiuma abbastanza persistente buona nota luppolsra cereali discreyachezza amaro medio leggere note citriche agrumate
Amber color with white head. Intense herbal and fruity aroma. Taste is light bitter pretty balanced with malts sweetness.
Amber coloured beer, the head is a bit small. Spices, malts and citrussy hops combined ok. Good bitterness.

Bottle:
No glass: another campfire beer, lovely to drink, enjoy and note rate it, but I truely cant yet so I wrote down the followin info and mixed it a bit into the following rating (what an experience)...
Smell hops, citrus, creamy hops and some barleys.
Taste lots of yeasty soapy  lemon less citrussy hops...
Very strange unbalanced character at first. But nothing is less true:
Half way it gets bettter: lot of typical  hops fruit and flavours. Nice!
Low medium carbo, soft mouthfeel, good medium body and some creamy tint ish texture.
Beginning this beer wasnt that good, but after a while, when I guess chambered a bit, it tasted way better.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Bottiglia da 33 cl. Color ambra opaco con schiuma di color nocciola, di grana media ma di buona persistenza. Al naso buoni i profumi erbacei e agrumati, al palato subito secca con un retrogusto di leggera liquirizia, finale molto amaro e lungo.

Bottle from Bir&Fud Bottega. Hazy light amber, white head. Good carbonation. Aroma of grapefruit, pine. Bitter and fruity taste of hops, with spicy yeast notes. Really refreshing and enjoyable to drink.

330ml bottle bought at Johnnys Off-License in Roma. Shared with Finn at a rating session back home. Pours a big rocky, white head that laces well. Unclear, amber-gold body. Mid-dry, resin-like hopped aroma. Fruity hops in flavour with notes of apricot and mandarin. Smooth bittersweet tail. More than just satisfying (Tromsø, 18.07.2012).

Flaske 0,33l påspandert av og delt med Rune under middag i WC74 18 Jul 12. Aprikosfarget med et høyt luftig skum som daler. Litt uklart. Sterk & god fruktig aroma. Aprikos. Smaken tørr frukt. Syrlig. Tørr - litt kunstig  - ettersmak.
Bottle. Deep orange, huge foamy almost white head. Aroma is floral hops, somewhat meaty, grassy and a bit spicy. Flavor is bitter hopped, quite clean. Nice balance, decent body and well done.

Draught at Chez Moeder Lambic, Fontainas. Somewhat hazy golden beer with a nice lasting cream colored head. Hoppy flavor aroma, lemongrass, grass, citrus, grapefruit notes, some biscuits and caramel. Hoppy dry flavor, grassy, floral, elderflowers, metal notes, citrus, some fruits. Long bitter grapefruit finish with hay and floral notes. Very much on the hop side, but in a good way.

Botella de 330ml.Vaso de ½ pinta. (Sugerencia de Valentin del Freiburg). Saboreada en jul´12. Color ámbar anaranjado y apariencia turbia. Espuma marfil y corona tupida. Bastante Buena retención que deja anillos en las paredes. Resinas y pino en nariz con cítrico subyacente naranja y mandarina- y malteado moderado. Al primer sorbo, los sabores terrosos, ásperos y resinosos proporcionan un amargor contundente. Cuerpo medio y carbonatación suave. Un rio amargo fluye a través de una estructura malteada, con naranja y toques de limón en el intermedio. Sin astringencia, el final es prolongado con limpio amargor. Retrogusto resinoso. ¡¡Una cerveza refrescante y de muy fácil asimilación!!
330ml bottle. ½ Pint glass. (Following Valentin´s from Freiburg- suggestion).Enjoyed on jul´12. Orangish amber color. Foggy. Off-white froth & close crown. Fairly good retention leaves rings on sides. Resins & pine to the nose with underlying citric orange & tangerine- & moderate maltiness. Earthy, rough & resiny flavors provide sharp bitterness at first sip. Medium body. Soft carbonation. Bitter river flows trough malty backbone. Orange in the middle & lemon touch. No astringency. Clean & long bitter finish. Resiny aftertaste. Refreshing & very easy drinkable beer!!

Cask (gravity) @ 28th Pigs Ear Beer and Cider Festival 2011, at The Round Chapel in Hackney, London, EnglandHazy matt medium yellow orange color with a small to average, frothy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate malty, caramel, toasted, moderate hoppy, orange - citrus, mandarin. Flavor is moderate sweet and bitter with a average to long duration, mandarin, riped citrus - orange. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft to flat. [20111207]

Hazy amber colored pour. Small off-white head, little lacing. Big floral hop aroma. Some malt and a slight tinge of roasted corn.  A kind of sour aroma as well. Big bitterness up front with some too-much-hops taste. Not overly bad, but obvious. A little dry, with little to no malt character. Underwhelming, but still manages to be quaffable.

3/VI/2012 - on tap @ Moeder Lambic, Italian Beer Festival (2012-579) Thanks to 77ships for sharing the beer! 
Clear orange to amber beer, big yellowish head, pretty stable, adhesive. Aroma: very fruity, strawberry jam, candy, some spices, dried peaches, bubble gum. MF: soft carbon, some forest fruits, little citrus, bitter hops. Aftertaste: dry bitter, quite fruity, grapes, peaches, some candy, bitter hops in the end.

Bottle from Dranken Geers, Oostakker, Gent, Belgium 26th May 2012 consumed at Garmisch Zugspitz campsite in Frank the camper Tues 29th May.  Birrificio Indipendente Elav Punks Do It Bitter 4.3%. Pours amber with off-white head, some haziness but I had refridgerated it which to be fair hasnt helped, not sure why I put it in the fridge. Soft in mouth and if truth be known even as this warms up it remains a little thin and watery.  A6 A3 T6 P3 Ov12  3.0

25 cl. draft @ Chez Moeder Lambic Fontainas // Italian Beer Festival // clear yellow, with a light touch of greenish citrus with a creamy white head // smells of citrus, exotic fruits & pine resin hops // taste is exotic fruit punch, caramel, tad sweet (due to the previous two things), peach, pine resin, sweet herbs, quite on the sweet as opposed to bitter side, especially considering the hoppy nature, hint citrus // m/m // my first English Pale Ale, one from Italy at that // apparently it is bit of a bogus style which doesnt exist in the UK

Draught  Huge, dense & fine, slightly cream-coloured head over fully hazy golden-amber/honey coloured beer. Superb citrus-fruity nose, full of C-hops, light ureum & sulphur. Light fruity-citrussy flavour, but unlike a comparable UK bitter, if finishes sweetish-weak. Some lemonzeste, but as if diluted in water; Light, even thinnish-watery. Definitely  misses cruelly some maltbacking - even if they were only neutral in taste.

Draft @ Moeder Lambic Italian Beer Festival 12.
Dorée/orangée, col épais beige.
Arôme est frais en agrumes, levure, pointe d epamplemousse et malt.
En bouche, malté, brève amertume pour un pétillant léger. Le tout via le houblon donne un profile très fruité/agrumes avec un fini rappelant ce grains sec et cette légère note de fini amer. 
Très facile à boire, pleine de saveur avec un petit pied de nez à Brewdog.
Bottle 33cl. Poors hazy orange with white head. Aroma grapefruit, peach, grass. Taste watery, nice bitter. Ok beer good on a hot day.

20/04/2012 Il Grillo Brillo (330ml bottle). Dorata, abbastanza torbida, schiuma leggera, poco persistente. Naso molto interessante, pesca, frutti tropicali, note floreali. In bocca è un po più monotona, abbastanza watery, molto carbonata. Nel complesso non è niente male, una bitter ben fatta, con un bel carattere dato soprattutto dal dry hopping. Però queste genere di birre in bottiglia rendono poco.
7th December 2011Cask at Pigs Ear. Cloudy amber beer. Bubbly okay white head. Light dry palate. Mildly citrus hops. Mild carbonation. Dry finish. Okay drinkable EPA.
UPDATED: MAR 31, 2012 Buona quasi ipa direa con quel qualcosa di bitter inglese! Promossa!
Assaggio allIBF di milano 2012...birra secca con luppoli in evidenza...beverina...
Questa è la birra che prediligo per laperitivo considerata la gradazione alcolica molto più bassa della media. Ha un bel naso agrumato e floreale ed è secca e asciutta in bocca, molto beverina.

una bitter con alcune note aromatiche ma molto secca e beverina.
certo con questi luppoli non è propriamente una bitter.comunque buona.

Per essere buona è buona, e pure tanto, ma non si capisce perchè ormai anche le bitter debbano piegarsi alla regola della pigna a tutti i costi. Ma come si può chiamare english pale ale una bitter con cascade e amarillo in DH?

Pours light copper with a small white head.  Nose is grapefruit and pine.  this doesnt strike me as an ESB from the smell, more like an IPA.  From the nose, it has promise.  The flavor even resembles more of an IPA, it has a good bitter kick in the end.  Front is sweet.  Mouthfeel is a little soft but has a pretty good aftertaste.
A: hops, grass, citrus, malt A: golden T: medium to heavy bitterness P: lb, drinkable O: 15/20
On tap at Macchesiete it is a very pleasant beer. White head, medium carbonation, dark golden cloudy colur. Toasted. So good. Very drinkable and refreshing.

Hazy golden colour, small white head. Aroma is fruity and gloral hops with some mild alcohollike sweetness with some slight sweet maltyness. Flavour is fruity and floral, but quite bigtime bitter, with some tealeafs, sweet malts. Balanced. Funny with the "alcohollike" sweetness in the aroma for being only 4.3 % abv in the beer, Im pretty not sure the alcohol is coming through...

From cask at Bree Louise. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma is peachy to grapefruity hoppy. Bitter, fruity, light citrusy and crisp hoppy. Smooth fruity and bitter finish. Nice and easy.

UPDATED: JUL 13, 2012 Draught at "Osteria della Birra" - Bergamo (BG).
Clear orange color, little bubbly aspect. Nice head of medium duration, much frothy and organic. Pleasant notes of hop, malty, clear aged flowers, cellar and with a little sour smell on the end. Fresh and hoppines taste, pleasant acidulous start with a decided bitter arid final. Pleasant alcoholic perception.
